data.title: Akhtar Mirza: Movies, Photos, Videos, News, Biography & Birthday
data.meta_description: Akhtar Mirza: Check out the list of all Akhtar Mirza movies along with photos, videos, biography and birthday. Also find latest Akhtar Mirza news on Times of India.
data.text:
OTT is a huge platform … It has opened the floodgates to all kinds of cinema … The star system is on shaky ground, says filmmaker Saeed Mirza

Times Network / Jul 01, 2024, 19:00 (IST)

Renowned filmmaker Saeed Mirza reflects on friend Kundan Shah's legacy, evolution, and impact on Indian cinema, and shares his own thoughts on the industry's changes and challenges.

Tathagata Ghosh: I was starstruck when Rajkummar Rao congratulated me and Payel for ‘Footprints’ big win

etimes.in / Apr 18, 2023, 15:40 (IST)

Filmmaker Tathagata Ghosh speaks to ETimes on his film 'Footprints' big win at the Critics' Choice Awards 2023, what it means to the team, the amazing experience he and actress Payel Rakshit had at the event and the takeaways.

Awards for Sharmila Tagore, Saeed Akhtar Mirza in Mumbai

TNN / Feb 07, 2023, 08:07 (IST)

As a tribute to renowned producer-director Bimal Roy, whose socially conscious films such as ‘Do Bigha Zameen’ and ‘Sujata’ continue to make us question and contemplate, an annual show in Mumbai honours the tallest of stars as well as forgotten legends from behind the camera.

Nukkad director, Saeed Akhtar Mirza: Sameer Khakhar was a man of huge talent and capable of much more, but unfortunately he got slotted in similar 'khopdi' type roles

TNN / Mar 15, 2023, 15:26 (IST)

Nukkad director Saeed Mirza recalls how Sameer had shared how good work had stopped coming to him, and he did not want to be slotted in 'khopdi' type of roles.

Screenwriter Saeed Akhtar Mirza says, The Kashmir Files is 'garbage'

etimes.in / Dec 19, 2022, 21:26 (IST)

Looks like Vivek Ranjan Agnihotri’s ‘The Kashmir Files’ has been mired into another controversy. Screenwriter and director Saeed Akhtar Mirza, known for his work in films like Mohan Joshi Hazir Ho (1984), Albert Pinto Ko Gussa Kyoon Aata Hai (1980), Salim Langde Pe Mat Ro (1989), called the historical-drama ‘garbage’ and said there’s ‘no point taking sides’.

History-sheeter killed in Rajasthan's Baran over old enmity; police refute death due to firing

TNN / Dec 18, 2022, 11:12 (IST)

A 45-year-old history-sheeter was beaten to death by at least 11 people from his village over an old enmity in Rajasthan’s Baran district late Saturday evening.

14 Indian films to be screened at the 44th Festival Des 3 Continents

TNN / Nov 26, 2022, 17:51 (IST)

Filmmaker, archivist and founder of Film Heritage Foundation, Shivendra Singh Dungarpur, is co-presenting and programming the representation of Indian films for the Classics section at the 44th edition of the prestigious Festival des 3 Continents that is set to be held from November 18 to November 27, 2022 in Nantes, France.

Kerala state film awards: Jury didn't watch 'Home', says Indrans; Saeed Akhtar Mirza calls it unfair

TNN / May 29, 2022, 06:47 (IST)

When pressed if it was about optics since Vijay Babu, the producer of Home is an accused in a rape case, Indrans nodded.

52nd Kerala State Film Awards: Dileesh Pothan bags the Best Director award

etimes.in / May 27, 2022, 16:38 (IST)

On the other hand, the award for the best film book was presented to Pattanam Rasheed for his work ‘Chamayam’. Vineeth Sreenivasan’s directorial film ‘Hridayam’ grabbed the award for the Best film with Popular Appeal and the music composer Hesham Abdul Wahab bagged the best music composer award for all the songs in the Pranav Mohanlal starrer ‘Hridayam’.

Sudhir Mishra: All of us remembered Kundan Shah a lot that day

Mumbai Mirror / Aug 23, 2019, 10:27 (IST)

Sudhir Mishra who met his filmmaker pals for lunch, revealed that middle of the road cinema, FTII and their late friend who made 'Jaane Bhi Do Yaaro' dominated the conversation.

Words like democracy, patriotism have lost meaning today: Saeed Akhtar Mirza

PTI / Jul 07, 2018, 16:45 (IST)

National Award-winning filmmaker Saeed Akhtar Mirza said words like democracy and patriotism sound hollow today and there is a need for the country to "retrieve" them.
